item.title: Moodymann - Forevernevermore ( Obi Series )
item.description:
Peacefrog | 2x12 | UK | 27.06.2019 | House, Deep House , Detroit House
Moodymann classic Forevernevermore gets a reissue on OG label Peacefrog and it's unquestionably a record that belongs in the collection of any and all fans of KDJ. Originally released back in 2000, the music has lost none of its freshness, brimming with raw funk and Motor City swagger. Blending cavalier sampling and agile instrumentation, the music darts through disco-infused hedonism, spoken-word mantras and blasts of soulful euphoria. Standouts are the timeless 'Don't You Want My Love', the gospel depth of 'The Thief That Stole My Sad Days', and the powerfully evocative title track. Must own, simple as that.
item.content:encoded: Peacefrog | 2x12 | UK | 27.06.2019 | House, Deep House , Detroit House Moodymann classic Forevernevermore gets a reissue on OG label Peacefrog and it's unquestionably a record that belongs in the collection of any and all fans of KDJ. Originally released back in 2000, the music has lost none of its freshness, brimming with raw funk and Motor City swagger. Standouts are the timeless 'Don't You Want My Love', the gospel depth of 'The Thief That Stole My Sad Days', and the powerfully evocative title track. Must own, simple as that.

item.title: Moodymann - Silence In The Secret Garden - Obi Edition
item.description:
Peacefrog | 2xLP Clear Vinyl | USA | 13 Apr 2018 | Deep house , Detroit House
Silence In The Secret Garden is an intensly personal and spiritual journey into the heart & soul of black music.From the reckless dark minimalism of the title track Silence In The Secret Garden to the irresistible funk of Yesterday’s Party… this classicalbum has continued to surprise and inspire. Smokey 2LP with limited edition Obi Stip to celebrate the 35-year

item.title: Swayzak - Floyd
item.description:
Rawax | 12 | Germany | Avril 2025 | House , Classic house
First released in 1999, Swayzak's 'Floyd/Doobie' shook the British duo's catalogue. Though it wasn't 'Bueno' or 'Fukumachi', this deep house cut was the next best choice for followers of the then burgeoning tech house circuit. Swayzak were already favourites on this and the deep house scene, and had clawed in acclaim for their involvement in both as early as 1993. One particularly prolix bio deems them the incipients of "1st wave 2000-era progressive deep minimal", which is too analytic even for us manic categorisers. No, we prefer to take these two big-hitters as they are: brimming with enthusiasm for a gadget-packed future, 'Floyd' fizzes and twitches with the pulsing blurts of a saw synth, as if to suggest constant magnetic stimulation from above. 'Doobie', meanwhile, hears our protagonist disrobe the techno utility belt, returning to a wireless home, so to gaze out over a subtly detuned chord landscape set to munching percs.
item.content:encoded: Rawax | 12 | Germany | Avril 2025 | House , Classic house First released in 1999, Swayzak's 'Floyd/Doobie' shook the British duo's catalogue. Though it wasn't 'Bueno' or 'Fukumachi', this deep house cut was the next best choice for followers of the then burgeoning tech house circuit. Swayzak were already favourites on this and the deep house scene, and had clawed in acclaim for their involvement in both as early as 1993. One particularly prolix bio deems them the incipients of "1st wave 2000-era progressive deep minimal", which is too analytic even for us manic categorisers. No, we prefer to take these two big-hitters as they are: brimming with enthusiasm for a gadget-packed future, 'Floyd' fizzes and twitches with the pulsing blurts of a saw synth, as if to suggest constant magnetic stimulation from above. 'Doobie', meanwhile, hears our protagonist disrobe the techno utility belt, returning to a wireless home, so to gaze out over a subtly detuned chord landscape set to munching percs.

item.title: Moodymann - Black Mahogani ( Obi series ) 3 vinyls
item.description:
Peacefrog | Clear & smokey vinyl 2xLP + 1-sided clear & smokey vinyl LP with obi-strip | UK | Octobre 2025 | Deep House , Detroit House
Over 20 years since its first release, Moodymann's Black Mahogani remains a landmark in deep house and Black American music. Originally issued in 2004, it's a richly atmospheric album that blends deep house, soul, jazz and cinematic textures into a singular Detroit statement. Drawing on earlier KDJ 12" releases, Kenny Dixon Jr. expands his palette with live contributions from Detroit legends like Amp Fiddler, Roberta Sweed and Norma Jean Bell. The result is a warm, analogue masterpiece full of emotional depth and tension, a timeless work that honours 1970s soul while reshaping electronic music with raw, organic elegance.
item.content:encoded: Peacefrog | Clear & smokey vinyl 2xLP + 1-sided clear & smokey vinyl LP with obi-strip | UK | Octobre 2025 | Deep House , Detroit House Over 20 years since its first release, Moodymann's Black Mahogani remains a landmark in deep house and Black American music. Originally issued in 2004, it's a richly atmospheric album that blends deep house, soul, jazz and cinematic textures into a singular Detroit statement. Drawing on earlier KDJ 12" releases, Kenny Dixon Jr. expands his palette with live contributions from Detroit legends like Amp Fiddler, Roberta Sweed and Norma Jean Bell. The result is a warm, analogue masterpiece full of emotional depth and tension, a timeless work that honours 1970s soul while reshaping electronic music with raw, organic elegance.

item.title: Elizio De Buzios - Tamanqueiro
item.description:
New Dawn | 7 Inch | Netherlands | Decembre 2021 | Funk , Brasil
Crate diggers and rare groove enthusiasts have long been fans of Elizio de Buzos' sole single, 'Tamanqueiro' - so much so, in fact, that the track has frequently been described as "the best Jorge Ben record that Jorge Ben never made". The record has long been tricky to find, hence this much-needed reissue on the Rush Hour-affiliated New Dawn label. The title track, which means 'clogmaker' in Portuguese, is an effortlessly funky fusion of jangling samba guitars, fast-fingered jazz-funk bass guitar, unfussy MPB drums and effervescent vocals from de Buzos. Over on the flip you'll find original B-side 'Sau Um Loco', an emotional, downtempo samba-soul number rich in luscious orchestration, twinkling electric piano and wide-eyed female backing vocals.
item.content:encoded: New Dawn | 7 Inch | Netherlands | Decembre 2021 | Funk , Brasil Crate diggers and rare groove enthusiasts have long been fans of Elizio de Buzos' sole single, 'Tamanqueiro' - so much so, in fact, that the track has frequently been described as "the best Jorge Ben record that Jorge Ben never made". The record has long been tricky to find, hence this much-needed reissue on the Rush Hour-affiliated New Dawn label. The title track, which means 'clogmaker' in Portuguese, is an effortlessly funky fusion of jangling samba guitars, fast-fingered jazz-funk bass guitar, unfussy MPB drums and effervescent vocals from de Buzos. Over on the flip you'll find original B-side 'Sau Um Loco', an emotional, downtempo samba-soul number rich in luscious orchestration, twinkling electric piano and wide-eyed female backing vocals.

item.title: Glenn Underground - Grass Root
item.description:
Strictly Jaz Unit Muzic | 2LP | USA | Decembre 2025 | House , Deep House
Chicago house guardian and Windy City legend in his own right, Glenn Underground is back with a long overdue follow-up to his previous Tech House LP all the way back in 1996 on Peacefrog. It finds him delivering eight tracks of pure, rooted rhythm designed to ignite the dancefloor and speak to your soul. From thumping kicks to crispy hi-hats and punchy deep bass, each track is covered with his sonic fingerprint and a masterful balance of emotional content and relentless drive. Subtly recalling the legacy of dons like Heard, Knuckles and Hardy, this is house music perfected over decades.
item.content:encoded: Strictly Jaz Unit Muzic | 2LP | USA | Decembre 2025 | House , Deep House Chicago house guardian and Windy City legend in his own right, Glenn Underground is back with a long overdue follow-up to his previous Tech House LP all the way back in 1996 on Peacefrog. It finds him delivering eight tracks of pure, rooted rhythm designed to ignite the dancefloor and speak to your soul. From thumping kicks to crispy hi-hats and punchy deep bass, each track is covered with his sonic fingerprint and a masterful balance of emotional content and relentless drive. Subtly recalling the legacy of dons like Heard, Knuckles and Hardy, this is house music perfected over decades.

item.title: Ricardo Villalobos - NDRA (Reissue)
item.description:
Rawax | 12 | Germany | Janvier 2026 | Minimal House , Techno
Rawax continues to explore the rich, deep and undeniably wonky back catalogue of Chilean minimal master Ricardo Villalobos. This time round, they've opted to reissue something truly historic: the Berlin-based wonk-king's in-demand 1996 debut, the 'N-Dra' EP. The A-side title track is far more forthright than his later productions, but still runs to nearly 13 minutes and combines restless techno kick-drums with flashes of South American percussion, oddball vocal samples, and plenty of lost-in-the-groove effects trickery - as well as a deliciously dirty, stabbing bassline. He doffs a cap to Playhouse - a label he'd later release on - via the late-night throb-and-jack of 'Say That You Love Me', which features great interplay between his dirty electronic bassline and looped classic house vocal snippets, while 'Trockenteile' is pleasingly scuzzy, dark and wayward.
item.content:encoded: Rawax | 12 | Germany | Janvier 2026 | Minimal House , Techno Rawax continues to explore the rich, deep and undeniably wonky back catalogue of Chilean minimal master Ricardo Villalobos. This time round, they've opted to reissue something truly historic: the Berlin-based wonk-king's in-demand 1996 debut, the 'N-Dra' EP. The A-side title track is far more forthright than his later productions, but still runs to nearly 13 minutes and combines restless techno kick-drums with flashes of South American percussion, oddball vocal samples, and plenty of lost-in-the-groove effects trickery - as well as a deliciously dirty, stabbing bassline. He doffs a cap to Playhouse - a label he'd later release on - via the late-night throb-and-jack of 'Say That You Love Me', which features great interplay between his dirty electronic bassline and looped classic house vocal snippets, while 'Trockenteile' is pleasingly scuzzy, dark and wayward.

item.title: Doc L Junior - Footnotes 3 (2025 Remastered)
item.description:
All That Jelly | 12 | Germany | Fevrier 2026 | House
This record is like the lost crown jewels of House Music with a story that spans decades. Originally programmed in 1998 on an Akai S3000XL, this was meant to be released on Bjørn Torske's Footnotes in 2001. Unfortunately the original matrix and the master DAT tapes got lost under crazy circumstances. Yet several years later the tapes were found by Sex Tags Mania in the studio of mastering engineer Helmut Erler and the record eventually got issued in 2009 when a totally different House sound was "en vogue." Then due to some unfortunate coincidences most of the records ended up in far flung Japan, and so this record stayed totally underground. Yet it became a cult hit when House Music and later Disco got a proper revival around 2010/11. So over the years prices for this rarity were rising and rising... Then fast forward to 2025: after a sunny day off Berlin's modular synthesizer show "Superbooth" ATJ boss Mr. Fonk and Doc L. Junior teamed up to finally reissue this gem with new masters by Andreas Kauffelt of "Schnittstelle" / Berlin. On this 12“ Norwegian Disco and Balearic sounds meet: funky but deep to the core, playful but hypnotic, stripped down but with baroque details. Truly one of House Music's greatest productions.
item.content:encoded: All That Jelly | 12 | Germany | Fevrier 2026 | House This record is like the lost crown jewels of House Music with a story that spans decades. Originally programmed in 1998 on an Akai S3000XL, this was meant to be released on Bjørn Torske's Footnotes in 2001. Unfortunately the original matrix and the master DAT tapes got lost under crazy circumstances. Yet several years later the tapes were found by Sex Tags Mania in the studio of mastering engineer Helmut Erler and the record eventually got issued in 2009 when a totally different House sound was "en vogue." Then due to some unfortunate coincidences most of the records ended up in far flung Japan, and so this record stayed totally underground. Yet it became a cult hit when House Music and later Disco got a proper revival around 2010/11. So over the years prices for this rarity were rising and rising... Then fast forward to 2025: after a sunny day off Berlin's modular synthesizer show "Superbooth" ATJ boss Mr. Fonk and Doc L. Junior teamed up to finally reissue this gem with new masters by Andreas Kauffelt of "Schnittstelle" / Berlin. On this 12“ Norwegian Disco and Balearic sounds meet: funky but deep to the core, playful but hypnotic, stripped down but with baroque details. Truly one of House Music's greatest productions.

item.title: St David - The Freakshow EP
item.description:
Chiwax | 12 | Germany | Janvier 2026 | House , Deep House
Bari-born Davide Disanto, better known as St. David, has carved a name for himself by reviving the punchy, groove-forward energy of 90s US house. Active on wax for over a decade, his records, steeped in MPC grit and garage swing, have gone on to demolish global vinyl charts and landed in sets from the likes of The Martinez Brothers, Jovonn, Chris Stussy and Riva Starr. Now through acid tacits Chiwax does his next EP emerge; a travelling four-track 'Freakshow' of well wrangled proportions, the most freakish of all being the gnarly, choppy 'On A Freaky Style' and the even wilder 'I Am Ready'.
item.content:encoded: Chiwax | 12 | Germany | Janvier 2026 | House , Deep House Bari-born Davide Disanto, better known as St. David, has carved a name for himself by reviving the punchy, groove-forward energy of 90s US house. Active on wax for over a decade, his records, steeped in MPC grit and garage swing, have gone on to demolish global vinyl charts and landed in sets from the likes of The Martinez Brothers, Jovonn, Chris Stussy and Riva Starr. Now through acid tacits Chiwax does his next EP emerge; a travelling four-track 'Freakshow' of well wrangled proportions, the most freakish of all being the gnarly, choppy 'On A Freaky Style' and the even wilder 'I Am Ready'.

item.title: D'Julz - Raw Toolz 3
item.description:
Chiwax | 12 | Germany | Decembre 2025 | House
We are very happy to present you the 3rd release from D'Julz on CHIWAX! The Bass Culture-Boss delivered again a fantastic rcords for us, showing here his big range and understanding of House Music! We are expecting to release this beauty mid. of October. Highly recommended!

Highly recommended!

item.title: Daniel Wang - Aphroasia Technubian (Remastered)
item.description:
Balihu | 12 | Netherlands | Fevrier 2026 | Disco , Nu Disco
Just over 30 years after it first started appearing in New York record stores, one of Daniel Wang's most beloved early EPs gets a remastered reissue. Created at a point when he was still learning his craft as a producer (he owned little more than a sampler and a couple of basic synths), the six tracks combined his deep-rooted love of disco culture with nods to the tactile deep house warmth of Pal Joey, the Burrell Brothers, and the organ-rich garage-house sounds of New Jersey dons the Basement Boys. Deep, sample-rich, tactile, melodious and evocative, some of its synth-heavy tracks sound like blueprints for what became the nu-disco sound of fellow New York residents Metro Area. More than that, it remains a genuinely brilliant six-track missive that has undoubtedly stood the test of time.
item.content:encoded: Balihu | 12 | Netherlands | Fevrier 2026 | Disco , Nu Disco Just over 30 years after it first started appearing in New York record stores, one of Daniel Wang's most beloved early EPs gets a remastered reissue. Deep, sample-rich, tactile, melodious and evocative, some of its synth-heavy tracks sound like blueprints for what became the nu-disco sound of fellow New York residents Metro Area. More than that, it remains a genuinely brilliant six-track missive that has undoubtedly stood the test of time.
